questions.question_text: A developer automated a Performer process using the Robotic Enterprise (RE) Framework. Which state executes after the Process Transaction state has a result of "Success"?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
'Success' transition

comments.content: What if it was the last transaction available in the queue?

Still goes get transaction data.
1. Bot does not know if it was last transaction yet.
2. Bot goes to queue and sees like 'oh there is no data, let me tell this to uipath studio.
3. Then in get transaction data state, bot goes to End process state with 'No Data' transition.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
get transaction data obviously
CORRECT

questions.question_text:
A developer automates a process which has an Excel file as input data. Because the Orchestrator is not connected, the developer needs to adapt the Robotic Enterprise (RE) Framework to use it with tabular data.
Where in the REFramework is it a best practice to read the data from the Excel file and store it in a global DataTable variable?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
B is correct

If we keep the Input Excel in InitAllApplications, when system exception occurs the bot will again read the Input Excel (which is not required). 
Hence the Answer has to be B.

comments.content: hey i have an exam tomorrow, can you please elaborate the answer to this question.
but there is no 'New state' in RE framework either xd literally no idea

discussion.content: None of the answer, this question (I hope) won't be in actual exam... but if I have to choose, I go with A. In reality what we can do is we can read the file in get transaction data and change queue item type to data row if I am not mistaken

Selected Answer: B
i think it's B

choices.B: In the Initialization state in the First Run sequence
choices.A: In a new state in the Main state machine, immediately after the Initialization state

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
D is correct
go with D
go with D

Selected Answer: D
Correct D

Selected Answer: D
Correct D
Answer is D

Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is D because in the Settings sheet you can also write hard coded values that you initialize in the project and which do not work in the Assets sheet.

choices.A:
Settings sheet contains only values used for the initialization of applications.
Assets sheet contains only Credential Assets stored in Orchestrator.
choices.B:
Settings sheet contains only hard-coded values.
Assets sheet contains all names of Orchestrator Assets including those of type Credential.
choices.C:
Settings sheet contains Credential Assets stored in Orchestrator.
Assets sheet contains hard-coded values.
choices.D:
Settings sheet contains hard-coded values and names of Credential Assets.
Assets sheet contains all names of Orchestrator Assets except those of type Credential.

questions.question_text:
A developer created a production level automation using the Robotic Enterprise (RE) Framework. Any values used within the automation are referenced from the Config.xlsx file included in the framework.
What are the differences between the Settings sheet and the Assets sheet in the Config.xlsx file?

choices.D: When the item remains in the "New" status for approx. 24 hours
choices.C: When the item remains in the "Retried" status for approx. 24 hours
choices.B: When the item remains in the "In Progress" status for approx. 24 hours
choices.A: When the item remains in the "Failed" status for approx. 24 hours

questions.question_text:
While working with a queue in Orchestrator, you notice that the status of one of the Queue Items has changed to Abandoned.
When does this happen?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: B
time to abandonment can be changed in the webconfig file of orch but most correct answer remains B

Selected Answer: B
correct answer is B

Selected Answer: B
obviously B
Answer- B

Selected Answer: B
B for sure

Selected Answer: B
Abandoned - the item remained in the In Progress status for a long period of time (approx. 24 hours) without being processed;

choices.D: Set the "Unique Reference" of the queue to "Yes" and add a descriptive "Reference" in the "Add Queue Item" activity.
choices.A: Create an Excel file of processed Queue Items and loop through the list to check if the current Queue Item has been processed before.
choices.B: Add a descriptive "Reference" in the "Add Queue Item" activity and check that it does not equal the "Reference" of the Queue Item last processed.
choices.C: Set the "Unique Reference" of the queue to "Yes" and "Auto Retry" of the queue to "No".

discussion.content: Ans: D

Selected Answer: D
D is correct, C is for confusing you

Selected Answer: D
D is correct but we need to check continue on error in add queue item actitivy because when have a duplicate item Studio throw exception

Selected Answer: D
D is correct !
auto retry is in case an item is cracked. It's not like filtering duplicates.

questions.question_text:
A developer creates a Dispatcher which extracts information from the top 30 mail messages in Microsoft Outlook and uploads that information into a queue.
What is the recommended way to avoid processing duplicates of the same Queue Items?
